column4: Is there a way to prevent NetworkManager from overwriting the data stored in /etc/resolv.conf? I use a custom DNS server, and the NetworkManager continually resets it to my local network DNS.
you can set your dns using ntwork manager applet
Where might I find this tool?
top right in gnome
I think I found something in the System > Preferences menu. Thanks.
do you have xfce composite enabled¿
If its not default, then no. It is in the settings, I presume?
somewhere on the preferences, long time since i used it
I found "Compositor" under "Window Manager Tweaks" and it is enabled.
no idea then, gnome-do stopped development a long time ago; have you tried Docky instead¿
I don't want a dock, which is what docky appears to be.
But thanks for the suggestion.
well if what you wanted is just a launcher, there are: Kupfer, Synapse and Launchy
Kupfer looks perfect. Thank you.
run: compiz --replace
I do that and all of my window borders/titles vanish.
then you did not install gtk decorator
Which package would that be under?
libdecoration0 is installed.
then dou don't have any theme installed, you can use any metacity or kde decorator
use your function keys to enable/disable touchpad
I'm using Xubuntu, but the hardware drivers don't recognize my touchpad as a touchpad, it thinks that it is a standard mouse.
